snippet: Mr. Sefolosha’s lawyer said his client believed four officers arrested him outside a Manhattan nightclub for no reason, breaking a bone in his leg and causing him to miss the N.B.A. playoffs.
abstract: Atlanta Hawks forward Thabo Sefolosha turns down plea deal for charges related to fight outside Manhattan nightclub; chooses to go to trial on principle, claiming he was falsely arrested and that police broke bone in his leg; charges against teammate Pero Antic, who was arrested at same time as Sefolosha, are dropped by district attorney's office.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sefolosha’s lawyer said his client believed four officers arrested him outside a Manhattan nightclub for no reason, breaking a bone in his leg and causing him to miss the N.B.A. playoffs.

headline.main: Thabo Sefolosha, Atlanta Hawks Player, Spurns Lenient Plea Bargain
headline.print_headline: N.B.A. Player Spurns Light Plea Deal in Police Scuffle
